intro: Antirrhinum versicolor, commonly known as the variable snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and produces tubular flowers that open in the morning. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Antirrhinum versicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
